values.description: This would solve a fundamental engineering problem and enable us to build larger, sturdier structures.
Solid walls that we can actually stand and build turrets on.
More types of clothing available to craft.
A bigger, better research desk would allow us to research bigger, better things.
Upgrading our wells to reach deeper and access more water.
An all-round better design that improves speed, range, reload and damage.

We could build cages. This would allow us to capture and interrogate certain people, temporarily store bounties, or even keep hostages for ransom.  Actually this is starting to sound pretty wrong, be careful we don't end up going down the wrong path.
If we have water, and we have cactus, then we could brew rum...
A nice balance for those who find fragment axes too clumsy and blunt, the plank retains some of the extra deadly traits of a regular sword, while still remaining ridiculously crude.

Heavy weapons.  Ridiculed by many and often hailed as "cock extensions", nothing is more amusing than watching some idiot try to fight with a weapon he can barely lift.  But, if you work very, very hard, if you master it and build the necessary strength... maybe, just maybe you could become something very dangerous...
Contains theories for ridiculous looking, advanced harpoon turret designs that can supposedly fire multiple shots.
Hemp is a much more efficient source of fabrics, and can also be used for narcotics or medicine.
Corpses make a mess and attract scavengers and predators and all kinds of trouble.  Incineration would be the most effective solution.

A specially made training dummy, its pretty clever. It will let rookies train their attack skills to about level 15.  There's no way a rookie can take his training any further than this without facing real combat.
A shorter variant of the Katana, they are fast and sharp but generally used as backup weapons.
Frustrated by heavily armoured opponents?  Want to cut them in half with a single sweep?  This is the weapon is for you!  (Disclaimer: super human strength not included).
Splint kits would allow medics to add support to leg injuries, helping you out-run cannibals and stuff.
A practice turret would be a quick way to train up some basic competence in the use of mounted turret weapons.
A bigger, better research desk would allow us to research bigger, better things.
A more energy-efficient light post
Heavy ranged weapons could defend the walls and keep bandits off our gates.  Mounting on the walls would be best, because once an enemy gets too close you would be vulnerable to attack.
Serious armour needs solid buggerin' plates of steel stuck on to it.
Much larger building shells with more secure workspace
A fancier crossbow string technology that could increase the power of all mounted crossbows by 10%.
A classic weapon, light, sharp and fast.  Deadly and beautiful, but the fine skill they require makes them less commonly used than other blades.
Things will go a lot smoother if we organise an efficient method to store and distribute our raw materials.  Otherwise things are going to get jammed up.
The heavy cleaver, it bridges the gap between sabres and heavy weapons.  Some people like 'em.
This crazy design could fire 6 shots in rapid succession, although it would probably sacrifice some power and accuracy.
Two shots instead of one, how great would that be?
A good all-round sturdy crop, though it needs grinding before you can make food.
We need something bigger than a shack if we are going to get any work done.
Using a lower friction material for the slide of a crossbow could increase the power by another 5%.
A bigger, better research desk would allow us to research bigger, better things.
This would speed up mining a great deal
A good heavy bladed sabre.
Some basic lighting so we're not working in the darkness

Building regular old houses isn't going to get us far.  We need to study some new fundamental engineering concepts that will allow us to build something bigger that can stand up to assaults from anything and everything.
A further 15kw upgrade to all small generators.

Things will go a lot smoother if we organise an efficient method to store and distribute our raw materials.  Otherwise things are going to get jammed up.  If a dude wants to haul a load of raw stone to the Stone Processor, and his inventory is full of iron ore, what's he gonna do?  Exactly.  He needs some kind of storage box.  Geez!
A practice turret would be a quick way to train up some basic competence in the use of mounted turret weapons.
A new weapon technology that should be more powerful and accurate than crossbow technology can achieve.
A smaller, lighter katana popular with ninjas because they're so good for stabbing.
A refinery to grind wheatstraw into flour that could then be used for food.
A stand-alone electrical light. On a post.
A powerful searchlight for mounting on gates and walls
One day we will have the greatest swordsmiths in the world and blades that can cut a man clean in half with a single cut.  Today though, we will have rusted junk.
Learning to picklocks is hard to get started in.  It's too late to learn once you're locked in a cage, training is needed to get your foot on the ladder.
Wheatstraw isn't edible until you bake it into bread.
The Stone Processor requires too much manpower, we need to improve the design so we can get more output with less workers.
A better training dummy would let rookies train their attack skills up to about level 10.
Farms by nature take a long time to grow, then suddenly harvest season comes and you have mountains of crops everywhere and nowhere to put them.  Storage is important, be ready for harvest.
We're not going to get any further mining resources by hand.  It's time to take it to the next level!
If we can make our own fabric it makes clothing and armour crafting more cost-effective.
Defensive walls that would keep all those bastard bandits out.
It would save us a lot of running around to sell goods if we could get the customers to come to us.
Advanced first aid kits would last longer and save more lives.
Things will go a lot smoother if we organise an efficient method to store and distribute our raw materials.  Otherwise things are going to get jammed up.
Better first aid kits would last longer and save more lives.
A big furnace that could melt down old metal weapons and armour back into raw iron.
To make our walls any bigger we would need to rebuild them with stronger foundations.
A bigger, better research desk would allow us to research bigger, better things.
Upgrading our wells to reach deeper and access more water.
First aid kits save lives, we need to look at being able to create our own.
Steel bars are used to craft advanced weapons and gear, we can refine them from raw iron ore.
Can't make much without metal can we?
Somewhere to rest and heal faster
Bigger buildings with more space.
Splint kits would allow medics to add support to leg injuries, helping you out-run cannibals and stuff.
An extended katana.  Heavier, with increase range and damage at the expense of speed.
A practice turret would be a quick way to train up some basic competence in the use of mounted turret weapons.
The ultimate level, the best equipment, the best scientists.
With this we would have the basis to make our own clothing and light armour.  The same equipment could also be used to make under-armour and bandages.
Learning to picklocks is hard to get started in.  It's too late to learn once you're locked in a cage, training is needed to get your foot on the ladder.
A new weapon technology that should be more powerful and accurate than crossbow technology can achieve.
A better bench is needed to make the higher level stuff.
Wind generators can generate power out of nothing!  Free energy!  At this stage we will have to buy the components needed to build it with.
This could give us a 50% boost to the power output of our generators.
Some basic lighting so we're not working in the darkness
Default start
With this we could craft clothes and stuff.  For wearing.
Chainmail eh? That's going to be bloody fiddly isn't it?
Damn rookies are useless.  Keep getting beat up because they can't hit anything.  A basic training dummy would let them train their attack skills up to about level 5.
Food that can be produced in desert environments
Copper Alloy Plates are required for more high-tech engineering projects.
A spotlight fitting for the double-barrel harpoon turrets
A crop suitable for dry environments.
The basic ability to mine and create building materials
An ancient way of turning crops into generator fuel.  Choose between electricity or starvation!
Train like a ninja and learn to knock people out from behind.
An electricity generator that runs on fuel.
A common crop in the swamps
A way to reliably grow crops indoors would be the ultimate advantage for survival outposts deep in the inhospitable zones where food can not normally be grown.
Smaller lighter generators would work better in environments with low wind, or provide more consistent power where the weather is erratic.
Each advancement in this study can increase battery capacity by 60
A potential 10kw increase to battery output power
Here we could craft fundamental electrical components and parts.
An alternative source of fabric manufacture, much more efficient but may be illegal in some parts.
A potential 10kw increase to battery output power
Better food can be made if more ingredients are available
An improved fuel generator.  Larger and more powerful.
Regular first aid kits are no help for Skeletons, we would need to craft special machinery kits to repair any damage.
Each advancement in this study can increase battery capacity by 60
Why bother with 2 machines that could be combined into one?  A stone mine that immediately produces building materials
The Stone Processor requires too much manpower, we need to improve the design so we can get more output with less workers, but it's going to need to be powered by a generator.
A spotlight that can be fitted to the mounted crossbow to help against night attacks
A further 15kw upgrade to all large generators.
An option to fit a spotlight to turrets for aiding against night attacks
If we can farm cotton we can use it to manufacture fabrics.
Train like a ninja and learn to knock people out from behind.
Train like a ninja and learn to knock people out from behind.
A more powerful large wind generator, with double the potential output
Iron plates are a fundamental building material for machinery.  It's vital that we can make our own.
One day we will have the greatest swordsmiths in the world and blades that can cut a man clean in half with a single cut.  Today though, we will have generic rubbish.
Default start
Batteries can store excess power and keep things running during emergencies.  They are especially important if you rely on wind power.
Somewhere to rest and heal faster
Refining of hemp oil for an alternative method of biofuel production.
Sake is a traditional Swamper's drink, but also very popular in the United Cities.  Alcohol production is often a good source of income.
A very common alchoholic drink, it would be a good source of income if we could produce it.
The starting point of crafting our own weapons.
A whole load of hats that could be crafted.
The production of hashish is dangerous, but potentially the most profitable.
Useful things for any traveller.
Stools and tables and stuff, totally useless really.
More useless furniture to clog up your house with.
An automatic version of the loom that requires minimal human work
An automatic version of the loom that requires minimal human work
A semi-automatic drilling machine that only needs a single operator
As skeletons get constantly damaged and repaired their bodies start to wear down.  When this wear becomes too much it can be repaired at a repair bed.
Important for any traveller, these tents are easily constructed out of spare fabrics and could save your life in an acid storm.
Important for any traveller, these tents are easily constructed out of spare fabrics and could save your life in an acid storm.
Important for any traveller, these tents are easily constructed out of spare fabrics and could save your life in an acid storm.
A bench that would enable us to craft ammunition for crossbows
Enables the crafting of Regular bolts
Enables the crafting of Heavy bolts
Enables the crafting of long-bolts
A bench where we could craft our own crossbows
Storage for various types of weapons and armour
Learning to picklocks is hard to get started in.  It's too late to learn once you're locked in a cage, training is needed to get your foot on the ladder.
Something to train your ability to steal things without making noise
Something to train your ability to steal things without making noise
Something to train your ability to steal things without making noise
Placing these on the roofs of buildings can collect the rainwater in areas where wells can't be used.
A forgotten weapon of the old empire.
Iron plates are a fundamental building material for machinery.  It's vital that we can make our own.
A copy of the Hiver's "Economy Legs" technology, this will be the stepping stone to replacement limb production.
A copy of the Hiver's "Economy Arms"
Advanced high-tech legs like what the skeletons have.
Advanced high-tech arms like what the skeletons have.
Advanced high-tech legs like what the skeletons have.
Advanced high-tech legs like what the skeletons have.
Advanced high-tech legs like what the skeletons have.
Savant's secret alchemical formula for turning skeletons into humans
